comment: * Describes the properties of a route.

variables.name: CONNECTION_STATE_DISCONNECTED
variables.comment:
* The default connection state indicating the route is disconnected.
     *
     * @see #getConnectionState

variables.name: CONNECTION_STATE_CONNECTING
variables.comment:
* A connection state indicating the route is in the process of connecting and is not yet
     * ready for use.
     *
     * @see #getConnectionState

variables.name: CONNECTION_STATE_CONNECTED
variables.comment:
* A connection state indicating the route is connected.
     *
     * @see #getConnectionState

variables.name: PLAYBACK_VOLUME_FIXED
variables.comment:
* Playback information indicating the playback volume is fixed, i.e. it cannot be
     * controlled from this object. An example of fixed playback volume is a remote player,
     * playing over HDMI where the user prefers to control the volume on the HDMI sink, rather
     * than attenuate at the source.
     *
     * @see #getVolumeHandling()

variables.name: PLAYBACK_VOLUME_VARIABLE
variables.comment:
* Playback information indicating the playback volume is variable and can be controlled
     * from this object.
     *
     * @see #getVolumeHandling()

variables.name: TYPE_UNKNOWN
variables.comment:
* The default route type indicating the type is unknown.
     *
     * @see #getType
     * @hide

variables.name: TYPE_BUILTIN_SPEAKER
variables.comment:
* A route type describing the speaker system (i.e. a mono speaker or stereo speakers) built
     * in a device.
     *
     * @see #getType
     * @hide

variables.name: TYPE_WIRED_HEADSET
variables.comment:
* A route type describing a headset, which is the combination of a headphones and microphone.
     *
     * @see #getType
     * @hide

variables.name: TYPE_WIRED_HEADPHONES
variables.comment:
* A route type describing a pair of wired headphones.
     *
     * @see #getType
     * @hide

variables.name: TYPE_BLUETOOTH_A2DP
variables.comment:
* A route type indicating the presentation of the media is happening
     * on a bluetooth device such as a bluetooth speaker.
     *
     * @see #getType
     * @hide

variables.name: TYPE_HDMI
variables.comment:
* A route type describing an HDMI connection.
     *
     * @see #getType
     * @hide

variables.name: TYPE_USB_DEVICE
variables.comment:
* A route type describing a USB audio device.
     *
     * @see #getType
     * @hide

variables.name: TYPE_USB_ACCESSORY
variables.comment:
* A route type describing a USB audio device in accessory mode.
     *
     * @see #getType
     * @hide

variables.name: TYPE_DOCK
variables.comment:
* A route type describing the audio device associated with a dock.
     *
     * @see #getType
     * @hide

variables.name: TYPE_USB_HEADSET
variables.comment:
* A device type describing a USB audio headset.
     *
     * @see #getType
     * @hide

variables.name: TYPE_HEARING_AID
variables.comment:
* A route type describing a Hearing Aid.
     *
     * @see #getType
     * @hide

variables.name: TYPE_REMOTE_TV
variables.comment:
* A route type indicating the presentation of the media is happening on a TV.
     *
     * @see #getType
     * @hide

variables.name: TYPE_REMOTE_SPEAKER
variables.comment:
* A route type indicating the presentation of the media is happening on a speaker.
     *
     * @see #getType
     * @hide

variables.name: TYPE_GROUP
variables.comment:
* A route type indicating the presentation of the media is happening on multiple devices.
     *
     * @see #getType
     * @hide

variables.name: FEATURE_LIVE_AUDIO
variables.comment:
* Route feature: Live audio. *

* A route that supports live audio routing will allow the media audio stream * to be sent to supported destinations. This can include internal speakers or * audio jacks on the device itself, A2DP devices, and more. *

* When a live audio route is selected, audio routing is transparent to the application. * All audio played on the media stream will be routed to the selected destination. *

* Refer to the class documentation for details about live audio routes. *

variables.name: FEATURE_LIVE_VIDEO
variables.comment:
* Route feature: Live video. *

* A route that supports live video routing will allow a mirrored version * of the device's primary display or a customized * {@link android.app.Presentation Presentation} to be sent to supported * destinations. *

* When a live video route is selected, audio and video routing is transparent * to the application. By default, audio and video is routed to the selected * destination. For certain live video routes, the application may also use a * {@link android.app.Presentation Presentation} to replace the mirrored view * on the external display with different content. *

* Refer to the class documentation for details about live video routes. *

* * @see android.app.Presentation

variables.name: FEATURE_LOCAL_PLAYBACK
variables.comment:
* Route feature: Local playback.
     * @hide

variables.name: FEATURE_REMOTE_PLAYBACK
variables.comment:
* Route feature: Remote playback. *

* A route that supports remote playback routing will allow an application to send * requests to play content remotely to supported destinations. * A route may only support {@link #FEATURE_REMOTE_AUDIO_PLAYBACK audio playback} or * {@link #FEATURE_REMOTE_VIDEO_PLAYBACK video playback}. *

* Remote playback routes destinations operate independently of the local device. * When a remote playback route is selected, the application can control the content * playing on the destination using {@link MediaRouter2.RoutingController#getControlHints()}. * The application may also receive status updates from the route regarding remote playback. *

* Refer to the class documentation for details about remote playback routes. *

* @see #FEATURE_REMOTE_AUDIO_PLAYBACK * @see #FEATURE_REMOTE_VIDEO_PLAYBACK

variables.name: FEATURE_REMOTE_AUDIO_PLAYBACK
variables.comment:
* Route feature: Remote audio playback. *

* A route that supports remote audio playback routing will allow an application to send * requests to play audio content remotely to supported destinations. * * @see #FEATURE_REMOTE_PLAYBACK * @see #FEATURE_REMOTE_VIDEO_PLAYBACK

variables.name: FEATURE_REMOTE_VIDEO_PLAYBACK
variables.comment:
* Route feature: Remote video playback. *

* A route that supports remote video playback routing will allow an application to send * requests to play video content remotely to supported destinations. * * @see #FEATURE_REMOTE_PLAYBACK * @see #FEATURE_REMOTE_AUDIO_PLAYBACK

variables.name: FEATURE_REMOTE_GROUP_PLAYBACK
variables.comment:
* Route feature: Remote group playback. *

* @hide

methods.name: public String getId()
methods.comment:
* Gets the id of the route. The routes which are given by {@link MediaRouter2} will have * unique IDs. *

* In order to ensure uniqueness in {@link MediaRouter2} side, the value of this method * can be different from what was set in {@link MediaRoute2ProviderService}. * * @see Builder#Builder(String, CharSequence)

methods.name: public CharSequence getName()
methods.comment: * Gets the user-visible name of the route.

methods.name: public List<String> getFeatures()
methods.comment: * Gets the supported features of the route.

methods.name: public int getType()
methods.comment:
* Gets the type of this route.
     *
     * @return The type of this route:
     * {@link #TYPE_UNKNOWN},
     * {@link #TYPE_BUILTIN_SPEAKER}, {@link #TYPE_WIRED_HEADSET}, {@link #TYPE_WIRED_HEADPHONES},
     * {@link #TYPE_BLUETOOTH_A2DP}, {@link #TYPE_HDMI}, {@link #TYPE_DOCK},
     * {@Link #TYPE_USB_DEVICE}, {@link #TYPE_USB_ACCESSORY}, {@link #TYPE_USB_HEADSET}
     * {@link #TYPE_HEARING_AID},
     * {@link #TYPE_REMOTE_TV}, {@link #TYPE_REMOTE_SPEAKER}, {@link #TYPE_GROUP}.
     * @hide

methods.name: public boolean isSystemRoute()
methods.comment:
* Returns whether the route is a system route or not. *

* System routes are media routes directly controlled by the system * such as phone speaker, wired headset, and Bluetooth devices. *

methods.name: public Uri getIconUri()
methods.comment:
* Gets the URI of the icon representing this route. *

* This icon will be used in picker UIs if available. * * @return The URI of the icon representing this route, or null if none.

methods.name: public CharSequence getDescription()
methods.comment: * Gets the user-visible description of the route.

methods.name: public int getConnectionState()
methods.comment:
* Gets the connection state of the route.
     *
     * @return The connection state of this route: {@link #CONNECTION_STATE_DISCONNECTED},
     * {@link #CONNECTION_STATE_CONNECTING}, or {@link #CONNECTION_STATE_CONNECTED}.

methods.name: public String getClientPackageName()
methods.comment:
* Gets the package name of the app using the route.
     * Returns null if no apps are using this route.

methods.name: public int getVolumeHandling()
public int getVolumeMax()
methods.comment: * Gets the maximum volume of the route.

methods.name: public int getVolume()
methods.comment: * Gets the current volume of the route. This may be invalid if the route is not selected.

methods.name: public String getAddress()
methods.comment:
* Gets the hardware address of the route if available.
     * @hide

methods.name: public String getOriginalId()
methods.comment:
* Gets the original id set by {@link Builder#Builder(String, CharSequence)}.
     * @hide

methods.name: public String getProviderId()
methods.comment:
* Gets the provider id of the route. It is assigned automatically by
     * {@link com.android.server.media.MediaRouterService}.
     *
     * @return provider id of the route or null if it's not set.
     * @hide

methods.name: public boolean hasAnyFeatures(@NonNull Collection<String> features)
methods.comment:
* Returns if the route has at least one of the specified route features.
     *
     * @param features the list of route features to consider
     * @return true if the route has at least one feature in the list
     * @hide

methods.name: public boolean isValid()
methods.comment:
* Returns true if the route info has all of the required field.
     * A route is valid if and only if it is obtained from
     * {@link com.android.server.media.MediaRouterService}.
     * @hide

methods.name: public void writeToParcel(@NonNull Parcel dest, int flags)

methodNames: public void writeToParcel(@NonNull Parcel dest, int flags)
